msItem.author: Bede
msItem.title: In Marci euangelium expositio
msItem.rubric: fol. 1ra Incipit pręfacio uęnerabilis bede presbiteri in euangęlio secundum marcum.
msItem.incipit: In expositione euangelii secundum marcum˷ opitulante ipsa euangelica gratia scripturi⸵ primo que fuerit eidem macro causa euangelii scribendi˷ breuiter insinuandum esse censuimus.
msItem.explicit: fol. 115va Hec est autem inquit uita eterna˷ ut cognoscant te unum uerum deum˷ et quem misisti iesum cristum. sicut in illa eternitate cognoscitur⸵ quo seruos perducet per formam serui˷ ut liberi contemplentur formam domini.

supportDesc.foliation: Foliated in modern pencil, with two pages labelled 64.

collation.signatures: Last page of each gathering numbered in ink by the text hand, ·i· to ·xv·, centred at the foot.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled in drypoint, pricked on the outer edges of the page. On fol. 1r, main horizontal rules occur from top to bottom at 19.5 | 33 | 235 | 249 | 307 mm; vertical rules, from left to right, at 19 | 87 | 93.5 | 99 | 162 | 206 mm. Line spacing 6.5 mm.

handDesc.handNote: Gothic textualis; there is some variation in the hand, but the implication of the colophon that it was entirely written by one scribe seems possible.
Directions to rubricator written in another shade of ink, in a small rounded hand.

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorated Lombardic initials open each new book: fol. 1ra, preface, long blue and golden I; 3rb, book 1, 10-line blue E with red, green, blue, and golden decoration; 30va, book 2, 7-line green E with red, blue, and golden decoration; 59ra, book 3, 7-line golden E with blue decoration; 87vb, book 4, 7-line red E with blue and golden decoration. At fol. 93ra, a 3-line golden P, part way though 4.2 (4.14), Pascha quod hebraice dicitur. Headings to books and chapters in red, with new sections opening with an enlarged red capital; those used for the list of capitula on fols. 1vb–3ra are more decorative, and are followed by a large rubricated title.

additions.p: A s. xiii or xiv hand adds many nota marks and provides running heads in most of the volume, with the book number marked in the centre of the recto and the chapter in the top-right corner in Roman numerals.
Title noted on cover, fol. iir, iiir, and lower pastedown in s. xvi and xvii hands; s. xv pen trials on lower pastedown.
Pressmarks: 2 (spine); MS Jesus Coll. Ox. C. 67 (blue label on spine); 1 Arch. 3–6 (white label on spine, upper pastedown); 9, 2080 = 61, (2) (fol. iir).

binding.p: Whittawed leather over oak boards. A parchment bookmark found between fols 65 and 66, as well as several pieces of straw.
binding.condition: Rebacked (reusing original leather), with paper endleaves added.
binding.decoNote: On spine, Beda super marcum (s. xiv).

history.origin: Written at Cirencester Abbey between 1149 and 1176. Fol. iir, Liber sancte Marie De Cirecestr’. D’ Andree abbatis secundi tempore scriptus per manum D’ odonis de Wica canonici D’ Adam delamora tunc Cantore. Andrew was abbot from 1147 to 1176. Adam was preceded in office by Gilbert, who was still cantor in 1149: H.E. Salter, ed., Cartulary of Oseney Abbey, Oxford Historical Society 89–91, 97, 98, 101 (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1929–1936), 4:28–29.
history.acquisition: Appears in the list of the books of John Prise in the 1602 donation willed to Jesus College by his son Gregory Prise (1535–1600). Neil R. Ker, ‘Sir John Prise’, The Library, 5th ser., 10, no. 1 (March 1955): 1–24.

listBibl.bibl: Andrew G. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts c. 435–1600 in Oxford Libraries (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1984), no. 801 and pl. 60.
